alert.note: Alert for Canyonlands, Natural Bridges; La Sal and Abajo Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued July 31 at 10:48AM MDT until July 31 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE PACK CREEK FIRE BURN AREA IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall are possible over the Pack Creek Fire Burn Area. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Utah, including the following areas, Canyonlands/Natural Bridges and La Sal and Abajo Mountains. * WHEN...Until 7 PM MDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the Pack Creek Fire Burn Area is expected during the period of the watch. Residents near the Pack Creek Fire Burn Area should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are monitoring the potential for heavy rainfall over the Pack Creek Fire Burn Area, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Canyonlands, Natural Bridges; La Sal and Abajo Mountains
